> **Unraveling Tunneling Nanotubes with Artificial Intelligence**
>
> **3D reconstruction of the cerebellar germinal layer reveals
> intercytoplasmic connections between developing granule cells**\
> ()
>
> ![](vertopal_8136e42996424bac96cdfa226e2ad211/media/image2.png){width="1.9583333333333333in"
> height="0.1111111111111111in"}

![](vertopal_8136e42996424bac96cdfa226e2ad211/media/image3.png){width="1.8041666666666667in"
height="0.2708333333333333in"}

> By integrating image segmentation, 3D reconstruction, and deep
> learning approaches, we discovered and characterized anatomically
> complex intercellular connections bridging pairs of cerebellar granule
> cells throughout the EGL. Connected cells were either mitotic,
> migratory, ortransitioning between these two cell stages, displaying a
> chronological continuum of proliferative and migratory events never
> previously observed *in vivo* at this resolution.
>
> **Cellwalker: A user-friendly and modular computational pipeline for
> morphological analysis using microscopy images**\
> (For being submmited by December in Bioinformatics Oxford)\
> Github:\
> Cellwalkor segmentation of 2D/3D microscopy images using machine
> learning or deep learning and is followed by a morphological analysis
> addon which we developed in Blender, a computer graphics software.

**Endoplasmic Reticulum Golgi transport quantiﬁcation using Genetic
Algorithms**

> An ongoing project with a PhD student at Institut Pasteur. We are
> investigating proteins involved in migration and their secretion in
> polarized cells (normal cells) and non-polarized epithelial cells
> (cancer cells). I have determined their diffusion and advection
> parameters employing genetic algorithms. This posteriorly can be used
> in pharmacological models.

> **Enrichment Analysis of Gene Expression Proﬁle and Immune Response
> against SARS-CoV-2 Variants in Patients Vaccinated with BNT162b2
> mRNA**
>
> Knowing the effects of each dose and to identify and verify new and
> existing risk groups that should be included in vaccination plans is
> highly important. To achieve this goal, a characterization of the gene
> expression of the Pfizer vaccine against COVID-19 was carried out in
> samples taken at different time intervals after the first and second
> doses. Additionally, neutralization of the immune response against the
> United Kingdom (UK) and South African (AF) variants in individuals was
> evaluated.
>
